newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean supermarket sales down in September.
newsitem.headline: Chilean supermarket sales down in September.

text.p: Supermarket sales in Chile slipped 2.4 percent in September with relation to the same month last year, the trade group ASACH said.
The figure brought the increase in supermarket sales in the first nine months of the year to 7.8 percent over the same period last year, said the group.

Sales of non-perishable items rose 6.5 percent in September, while perishable meat sales fell 4.2 percent and other perishable items dipped 0.2 percent. Sales in the catch- all "other" category fell 18.5 percent.
The September decline followed sharp rises in supermarket sales in the previous three months.
